en: Touch the mat with your forehead.

Lean forward and let your forehead touch the mat.

Touch the mat with your brow.
Rest your forehead gently against the mat.
Let your forehead rest on the mat for a moment.
Lower your head and touch the mat with your forehead.
Bring your brow to the mat.
Gently bring your forehead to the mat.
Touch the mat with your forehead, ensuring contact.

ru: Одну ногу поднимите назад и вверх.
en: Lift one leg upward and back, aligning your posture.
Tuck your elbows close to your torso.
enSynonyms: Draw your elbows in towards your body.
Press your elbows firmly against your sides.
Bring your elbows into alignment with your trunk.
Hug your elbows tightly to your ribcage.
Secure your elbows snugly alongside your torso.

en: Extend one arm straight out fully.
Reconnect your hand to the mat with grounding intention, palm meeting its supportive surface.
enSynonyms: Bring the hand back to rest on the yoga mat
Guide your palm to settle mindfully onto the mat surface
Allow the arm to lower with control, fingertips meeting the mat’s supportive surface
Return your palm earthward, re-establishing connection through the base of the hand
With your exhale, let the hand descend like a leaf touching down, anchoring energy into the ground
As you stabilize through the core, draw the hand back to its starting position on the mat’s textured plane

en: Lengthen your opposite arm forward with fluid intention, fingertips reaching as an extension of your spine.
enSynonyms: Extend the remaining arm forward with mindful intention
Guide your alternate arm to stretch fully from shoulder to fingertips
Reach the second arm outward, maintaining shoulder alignment as you expand through the collarbone
With an inhale, sweep the opposing arm forward like a river’s current, palm facing earthward
Let your arm become an arrow of energy, extending with purpose toward the horizon
As you root through your sitting bones, lengthen the other arm as if drawing a line of balance through space

en: Return your hand to the mat.
enSynonyms: Place your hand back on the mat.
Bring your hand back to the mat.
Reposition your hand on the mat.
Put your hand back on the mat.
Return your palm to the mat.
Set your hand down again on the mat.
Bring your hand to rest on the mat.
Lower your hand back onto the mat.
Reposition your hand onto the mat.
Place your palm back on the mat.
Move your hand back to the mat.
Bring your hand back to the surface of the mat.
Set your hand down on the mat once again.
Lower your palm to the mat.
Reestablish your hand on the mat.
Reclaim your hand's position on the mat.
Return your palm gently to the mat.
Reposition your hand onto the surface of the mat.

en: Extend both arms laterally in a controlled expansion.
enSynonyms: Stretch both arms outward to form a horizontal line
Open your arms wide, creating space across the collarbones
Engage your shoulder blades as you press hands away from midline
With palms facing earthward, reach through fingertips in opposite directions
Flow into a graceful T-formation, energy radiating through extended limbs
Now, sweeping outward—yes, that's it—let arms float parallel to the floor like wings

en: Simultaneously lift both arms with coordinated intention.

ru: Поднятое колено выпрямите и носок натяните на себя.
en: Extend the lifted knee into a straight line and flex the foot, drawing toes toward the torso.
enSynonyms: Straighten your raised leg fully, actively pulling the foot back
Lengthen through the elevated knee, engaging the quadriceps as you dorsiflex the foot
Initiate from the hip—yes, like so—to straighten the leg while creating resistance through the flexed foot
Ground through the standing leg as you articulate the raised limb into full extension, heel reaching forward
Flow into a long, energized leg position: knee lifted becomes straight arrow, foot in active flexion (imagine pressing against a wall)
Now, with intention—feel the hamstring engagement here—extend that knee and scoop the toes back toward your heartspace

en: Press your heel back and upwards.
enSynonyms: Push your heel backward and upward.
Drive your heel back and lift it slightly.
Apply pressure through your heel, directing it back and up.
Engage your heel, pressing it firmly backward while lifting it upward.
Anchor your heel by pressing it back and gently elevating it to create length.

en: Release your arms downward with intention, drawing them inward to anchor near the body’s midline.
enSynonyms: Lower your hands close to your sides, hugging the torso
Bring arms down alongside the body, palms facing inward
Engage the latissimus dorsi to lower the arms with control, then activate the core as elbows draw near the ribs
Initiate from the shoulders—smoothly—allowing arms to descend while maintaining scapular stabilization, then tuck elbows snugly toward the ribcage
Flow into grounding—yes, release that tension—letting arms waterfall down as you gather energy toward your center
Earth the limbs—palms now receptive—as if gathering a weighted sphere toward your navel chamber

en: Execute a controlled push-up while maintaining rigid arm alignment.
enSynonyms: Perform a precise push-up with elbows locked in full extension
Press through the palms, arms unwavering as steel cables
Engage triceps and core stabilization to prevent elbow flexion during descent
Initiate scapular protraction—yes, like so—while preserving straight-line energy through the arms
Flow into chaturanga essence – torso hovering, limbs creating unyielding angles of support
Now, with warrior’s discipline – exhale into the push-up phase while maintaining arm integrity as if resisting gravitational pull

ru: Согните вытянутую ногу и противоположной кистью перекрёстно возьмитесь за голень.
en: Bend your extended leg and cross your opposite hand to hold the shin.

Bend your outstretched leg and reach across with the opposite hand to grip the shin.
Curve the extended leg and cross your hand over to clasp the shin.

Bend your straightened leg and grab the shin with a cross reach of the other hand.
Fold the leg and reach across with the opposite hand to secure the shin.
Flex the extended leg and use the opposing hand to grasp the shin.
Bend your leg and take hold of the shin by crossing the opposite hand over.
Bring the extended leg into a bend and diagonally hold the shin with the other hand.
Bend the outstretched leg and reach across to clasp the shin with your other hand.
Fold the extended leg, using your opposite hand to grip the shin in a crosswise motion.
Bend your leg and cross the opposite hand to grasp the shin firmly.
Flex the straight leg and take the shin with a diagonal reach of the opposing hand.
Bring your leg into a bend and secure the shin with the opposite hand crossing over.
Fold your extended leg and cross the opposite hand to hold the shin firmly.
Bend the leg and use the other hand to cross over and clasp the shin.
Flex your leg and diagonally reach to grasp the shin with the opposite hand.
Curve the leg and cross the hand over to take hold of the shin.
Bring your leg into a bend and grasp the shin with a cross-reach of the other hand.
Bend the extended leg and secure the shin by reaching across with the opposite hand.

en: Eka Hasta Vyaghrasana.
One Handed Tiger Pose.

ru: Поднятый плечевой сустав подайте вперед и вниз.
en: Guide the elevated shoulder joint through a deliberate forward and downward trajectory.
Elevate the extended leg upward with intentional engagement.
enSynonyms: Lift your leg skyward, maintaining muscular activation through the posterior chain
Raise the limb vertically while preserving spinal alignment
Initiate from the hip socket—yes, precisely—to create length through the hamstring as you ascend
Engage quadriceps and core stabilization to articulate the leg’s upward trajectory
Flow into upward extension – imagine your heel brushing against celestial energy
With mindful control—feel the ischial tuberosity anchor—draw the femur upward as if suspending it from cosmic threads

ru: Таз сместите в сторону поднятой ноги.
en: Shift your hips towards the side of your lifted leg.
enSynonyms: Move your pelvis in the direction of your raised leg.
Adjust your hips to align with the side of your elevated leg.
Gently tilt your hips toward the side where your leg is lifted.
Reposition your hips to face the side of your leg that is raised.

ru: Поднятое колено подайте в сторону опорной ноги.

en: A narrow corridor.
The chest is open and expanded.
enSynonyms: Keep your chest open and lifted.
Maintain an open and broad chest position.
Ensure your chest is expanded and upright.
Hold your chest wide and open, creating space.
Keep your chest lifted and the ribcage broad.
Allow your chest to remain open, with the shoulders back.
Maintain an expansive chest, promoting openness.
Hold your ribcage open and lifted with ease.
Keep the chest broad and open, ensuring a feeling of space.
Focus on holding your chest wide and expansive.

ru: Пятку согнутой ноги прижмите к ягодице.
Выпрямите согнутую ногу и выведите таз вверх и назад.
en: Straighten your bent leg and lift your pelvis upward and backward with mindful extension.
enSynonyms: Extend your previously bent leg fully while raising the hips skyward and posteriorly
Straighten the flexed knee joint and elevate the pelvic bowl in an upward-backward trajectory
Release the bent leg into full extension while drawing the sacrum toward the ceiling
Engage your hamstrings to straighten the leg and tilt the pelvis upward-backward
Align the extended leg with spinal integrity while lifting the pelvic floor

ru: Одну кисть поставьте вперед на коврик.
en: Place one hand forward on the mat.

ru: Вытяните поднятую ногу назад и вверх.
en: Stretch your lifted leg back and up.
enSynonyms: Extend your raised leg backward and upwards.
Reach your elevated leg behind you and upwards.
Straighten your lifted leg, moving it back and upward.
Stretch the lifted leg behind you, reaching it upward.

en: Eka Pada Adho Mukha Svanasana.

ru: Собака мордой вниз на одной ноге.
en: One-Legged Downward Facing Dog Pose.
Reach your chest towards your knee.

ru: Пятку опорной стопы потяните к коврику.
en: Pull the heel of your standing foot back toward the mat as you press your toes down, keeping your foot firm and steady.
Push up by bending your elbows.

Engage your chest and arms as you bend your elbows for the push-up.
Keep your body aligned as you bend your elbows to perform the push-up.
Bend your elbows deeply, then push through your arms to rise back up.

Complete the push-up by bending your elbows and pushing your body upward.

en: Lower your elbows to make contact with the mat surface.
enSynonyms: Rest elbows gently on the practice surface
Bring forearms down to meet the mat
Engage scapular stabilization as you articulate elbow joints toward the earth plane
Initiate controlled descent of upper arms—yes, like so—until olecranon processes connect with support surface
Flow into grounding phase—palms may lift as focal weight transfers through antecubital regions
Now, with mindful intention—feel the triceps engage here—allow elbow crowns to kiss the earth beneath you

ru: Сохраняя поднятую ногу вытянутой, противоположной кистью возьмитесь за голень.
Протяните вперед одно, затем другое колени к кистям.
en: Guide each knee sequentially toward the wrists in a flowing forward extension.
enSynonyms: Alternately draw each knee forward to meet the corresponding wrist
Bring one knee at a time toward the hands in deliberate succession
Initiate from the hip sockets—yes, like so—to articulate each knee toward the hands while maintaining spinal length
Engage core stabilization as you sequentially guide patellas toward palmar surfaces
Flow through a kneeling progression—first left then right—as kneecaps seek alignment with wrist creases
With rhythmic intention—inhale prepare, exhale advance—orchestrate each knee’s journey toward hand anchors

en: Lower the pelvis between the heels.
